newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Wheat Board closes durum pools.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Wheat Board closes durum pools.

text.p: The Australian Wheat Board (AWB) said it closed its 1996/97 pools for all grades of durum wheat, effective at 0600 GMT (5 p.m.) Monday.
Most supplies of durum of all grades have been committed, said Ron Story, the AWB's general manager merchandising.
"There's not much more durum out there, and the prospects of accumulating another cargo are limited," he said in a statement.
"Therefore we are closing the pool to protect the equity of the growers who have delivered into the number one durum pools," he said.
Story said the current estimated FOB pool return per tonne for the closed pools are: durum one A$262, durum two A$247 and durum three A$227.
The 1996/97 number one pools for all other grades of wheat remain open, he said.
